package.code:
import dtlpy as dl


class ServiceRunner:
    @staticmethod
    def run(dataset: dl.Dataset, service: dl.Service):
        # Define filters
        filters = dl.Filters()
        filters.add(field="dir", values="/")
        item = list(dataset.items.list(filters=filters).all())[0]

        # Execute service
        execution = service.execute(
            execution_input=[
                dl.FunctionIO(
                    name="item",
                    type=dl.PackageInputType.ITEM,
                    value=item.id
                )
            ],
            project_id=dataset.project.id,
            function_name="extract_item"
        )

        # Wait for service execution to finish
        execution.wait()
        if execution.status != dl.ExecutionStatus.SUCCESS:
            raise ValueError(
                f"Service execution '{execution.id}' failed with status: '{service.status}'"
            )

        # Validate execution output
        execution_output = execution.output
        assert isinstance(execution_output, dict)
        item_id = execution_output.get("item_id", None)
        assert item_id == item.id

        # Get the newly created feature
        feature_set_name = 'clip-feature-set'
        feature_set = dataset.project.feature_sets.get(feature_set_name=feature_set_name)
        filters = dl.Filters(resource=dl.FiltersResource.FEATURE)
        filters.add(field="entityId", values=item_id)
        features = feature_set.features.list(filters=filters)
        features_count = features.items_count

        # Validations
        assert features_count == 1
        feature = list(features.all())[0]
        assert feature.entity_id == item_id
        assert isinstance(feature.value, list)
        assert len(feature.value) == 512
        print("Service execution completed successfully!")
package.name: run
